meanings.definition: A compound consisting of a nucleoside linked to a phosphate group.
meanings.sent1: A nucleotide is like a building block made of a nucleoside and a phosphate group.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study how nucleotides form the structure of DNA and RNA.
meanings.sent3: The nucleotide tried to make friends with the other molecules in the cell.
meanings.sent4: In the genetic code, each nucleotide is a unique piece of the puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used colorful blocks to represent each nucleotide in the molecule.

meanings.definition: The basic structural unit of nucleic acids such as DNA and RNA.
meanings.sent1: DNA and RNA are made up of many nucleotides joined together.
meanings.sent2: Every nucleotide plays a crucial role in the structure of genetic material.
meanings.sent3: The nucleotide family reunion was a big hit in the cell nucleus.
meanings.sent4: The nucleotide orchestra harmoniously played the music of life.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the nucleotide looked like a tiny, important brick in the DNA wall.
